The page description mentions changes in grain self-sufficiency rates due to temperature changes under Scenario RCP4.5, 2050, but specific numerical values are not provided. Assigning 0 as a placeholder.
Grain self-sufficiency rate in India increases slightly in RCP8.5 2100 due to maize. Grain consumption is reduced by 4%, wheat consumption by nearly 10%.
Increase in grain self-sufficiency rate due to adaptation, mainly due to wheat.
Direct climate change impacts via land productivity reduction, especially for rice, avoided by adaptation.
All regions benefit economically from increased grain prices. USA, China, India, and Pakistan farms benefit most due to increased farm income by 2100 under RCP8.5 scenario - no specific value given.
Losses in grain output could be 25% of current output in the climate of RCP8.5 in 2100, but less than 5% if producers adapt well. Therefore, adaptation leads to 20% of avoided losses (25-5=20).
